hints.content: Start by understanding that you need to create a number using digits from both arrays. Think about how you can combine digits from `nums1` and `nums2` to form a valid two-digit number.
Consider the simplest case where both arrays have a common digit. What would the result be in this scenario? This can help you identify the smallest number directly.
If there are no common digits between the two arrays, you will need to combine digits from both arrays. Think about how to form two-digit combinations using one digit from each array.
When forming numbers, remember that the smallest digit should be in the tens place if possible. This will help ensure that the number you create is as small as possible.
You can sort both arrays to make it easier to find the smallest digits. After sorting, the smallest digits will be at the beginning of each array.
Consider all combinations of digits from `nums1` and `nums2`. For each pair, construct the two-digit numbers and keep track of the smallest one.
When comparing two-digit numbers formed from the digits, ensure to handle cases where the digits are the same. For example, if `nums1` has 3 and `nums2` also has 3, the result should be 3.
Think about edge cases, such as when one array has only one digit. How would that affect your combinations? Make sure to test your logic against such scenarios.
After generating all possible two-digit numbers, you will need to determine the smallest one. Consider using a variable to keep track of the minimum number found.

Finally, ensure your solution handles all constraints, such as the uniqueness of digits and the requirement to include at least one digit from each array. Review your logic to confirm it meets these requirements.

questionNotes: All digits in each array are unique.
Return the smallest number that contains at least one digit from each array.
